irq 9 is a cascade irq for the PC... you really should nt have issues with it unless you have old ISA cards AND PCI cards fighting over it.
check your BIOS and see how IRQ 9 is assigned... what might be using it... do you have any ISA cards in that PC
are you familiar with your BIOS setup utility?

if you have a hardware issue (even just a config issue - not just broken hardware), that can certainly cause an install fail... considering two distros have complained about a device they think is in irq9 not responding I'd say you need to check your laptops BIOS to see if there is something there that may be assigned to irq9 that should not be)
